artist: Artist: Unknown Italian, late 18th - early 19th century
creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund
description: Forty-seven pages with drawings on front and back covers; bound in vellum
markings: Watermark: Bull and inscription NAIAT, coat of arms
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush wash, graphite, and watercolor on laid paper; bound volume
provenance: (Hans Calmann, London, until 1968; sold, June 10 for £200, to MIA).
text: This sketchbook is crammed with hundreds of studies of Italian landscapes, classicizing figures, and antique sculpture. The landscapes and works of art sketched on the pages locate the artist in the vicinity of Rome and Naples, where Francesco di Bartolomeo Guerrini, a Sienese artist, was active in the years coinciding with the few dates written in the book. The frenzied sketches, careful studies, and uninhibited scribbles offer a tantalizing glimpse into the artist’s private thoughts and inspirations.
title: Italian Sketchbook of Antique and Revolutionary Subjects
